p: Defendant denies upon informa- tion and belief, that persons at defendant's house when Plaintiff was urging said child to leave said place, and go to a good place provided by him for her, threatened to mal- treat Plaintiff if he did not de- sist from his effort. Defendant admits that she did not re- prove? said person, but denies that she took said child with a private apartment where Plaintiff could not approach her, thus defying Plaintiff's authority over said child as her father.

Defendant further answering says that she denies that Plaintiff has by his sister and the aunt of said child unknown! to get said child (new page) from said place but were treated with great con- tempt and harshness and defendant further answering? denies that Plaintiff is fearful that if he should attempt to unknown! said child away from said place, that persons in the unknown! of defendant would maltreat and misuse Plaintiff.

Defendeant further answering says that she ------------------- --------------------------------- --------- denies upon infor mation and belief Plaintiff is a mor al man of good indentioned habits and denies that Plaintiff has always provided a good home and the com forts of life to the best of his ability for said child and defendant admits that where she went to the house of the defendant she had been living at the house of a good and respectable (new page) farmer of good moral repute. Defendant denies upon information and belief that Plaintiff is now unknown! to have his said child at school, and her moral training attended to. Defendant further answer ing denies ------ that unknown! his Honor awards his said child to him she will soon be ruined in character and morals.
And this defendant for a further answer and return to said appli- cation says. That she is informed and believes that said Louisa is over the age of fifteen (15) years

And for further answer said defendant unknown! that unknown! or unknown! the 1st day of September AD 1866 said Louisa came freely and voluntarily to the house or residence of this defendant in said Court, and that the said Louisa remained there freely and voluntarily to the present time. That said (new page) Louisa did not at any time remain there by through or under any threat fear coer- cion or restraint acts or during exercised unknown! unknown! contrived or brought about in opposition to the said Plaintiff or so that he could not at any time have the care control or custody of his said daugh- ter. And defendant further unknown! that she is informed and believes that at the time said Louisa came to defendant's place as aforesaid?, the defendant -----? was then absent from this Territory and in the Territory of Montana Territory and had been so absent from this Territory and afore said since the 1st of May 1866? or thereabouts, and said Plaintiff did not return from Montana Territory aforesaid to this City until sometime in the late part of the month of October 1866 or therabouts.

(new page) Defendant further answers unknown! that she is informed and verily believes that said Plaintiff for several years lost unknown! has not made any provision for the support care custody or instruction of said Louisa and particularly as the Defendant is informed and verily believes that in? the times said Plaintiff so left this Territory as aforesaid he did not make any provision for the care support custody or instruc- tion of said Louisa And defendant for further answer ------- says that at the time said Louisa came to defendant's residence ass aforesaid, she was poorly clad, in want, and actually suffering for the neccessaries of life and That the defendant has provided for the support of said Louisa over unknown! And the defendant further answers unknown! upon information and belief that this Plaintiff has not? any home in which (new page) to take his said daughter Louisa And this defendant further unknown! syas that she is a married woman and the wife of Leonidas? Whitesides who is unknown! unknown! unknown! unknown! unknown! unknown! unknown! absent from this Territory and that she has a family of his children, and that she is of good moral character, and that unknown! said Louisa has been at her house as aforesaid she the said Louisa unknown! associated with and kept the company of those of good moral character and that she has been kind affec tionate and motherly towards the said Louisa, and that said Louisa has always had a good and welcome home with this defendant, and has ----- frequently if pressed? her desion? to stay with this defendant.

And defendant further answering says that ssince the said Louisa has been with this Defendant (new page) aforesaid, she the said Louisa has always conducted herself with his? creek? prudence and with becoming dignity and has always been kind and affectionate towards this defendant faithfully attending her the said defendant in sickness and always exhibiting a spirit of gentleness and moral work.

And this defendant for further answer need retain to said Plaintiff application says. That she is now in such a condition of health that it would be perilous and unsafe for her to per sonally appear before his Honor J.E. Wyche Dist. Judge as aforesaid, and produce the said Louisa Jane Derrick as commanded in said writ of Habeas Corpus and prays the Honorable Court to decide? her home with her costs? unknown! unknown! unknown!
